headline: Even a 15% tariff rate for autos means new car prices could rise about 8.1%, or $4,300: Report

headline: Automotive Hall of Fame to Broadcast 2025 Induction Ceremony Globally for Second Year
summary: Following the resounding success of its first-ever global broadcast in 2024, the Automotive Hall of Fame is proud to announce the return of its broadcast of the Induction Ceremony on September 25, 2025, from The Department at Hudson's in downtown Detroit beginning at 6 p.m. ET.

raw.headline: Automotive Hall of Fame to Broadcast 2025 Induction Ceremony Globally for Second Year

headline: Europe to Remove Duties on U.S. Industrial Goods to Get Lower Car Tariffs: Report
summary: EU cars and parts are currently subject to a 27.5% U.S. tariff. Most goods are only subject to a 15% tax.

raw.headline: Europe to Remove Duties on U.S. Industrial Goods to Get Lower Car Tariffs: Report

headline: How Cadillac’s EV Surge and Formula One Push at GM (GM) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Mary Barra, CEO of General Motors, was recognized as a 2025 Automotive News All-Star for her leadership in the automotive industry, while Cadillac has achieved a major repositioning by increasing electric vehicles to almost a third of its sales and announcing a 2026 Formula One entry. This commitment to innovation and expanded engagement in electric and performance vehicles highlights how the company is enhancing its luxury brand appeal alongside technological advancements. We'll explore how...
